qas.question: How many people were confirmed dead?
How many people were confirmed dead only in the Sichuan province?
How many people were left homeless because of the earthquake?
How many people lived in the affected area?
How much money was dedicated to rebuild ravaged areas?
How many people died in Sichuan Province?
How many were injured in Sichuan?
How many people are listed as missing?
How many people are homeless because of the quake?
How high could the homeless number possibly go?

context: Official figures (as of July 21, 2008 12:00 CST) stated that <a0_0>69,197<a0_0/> were confirmed dead, including <a1_0><a5_0>68,636<a5_0/><a1_0/> in Sichuan province, and <a6_0>374,176<a6_0/> injured, with <a7_0>18,222<a7_0/> listed as missing. The earthquake left about <a2_0><a8_0>4.8 million<a8_0/><a2_0/> people homeless, though the number could be as high as <a9_0>11 million<a9_0/>. Approximately <a3_0>15 million<a3_0/> people lived in the affected area. It was the deadliest earthquake to hit China since the 1976 Tangshan earthquake, which killed at least 240,000 people, and the strongest in the country since the 1950 Chayu earthquake, which registered at 8.5 on the Richter magnitude scale. It is the 21st deadliest earthquake of all time. On November 6, 2008, the central government announced that it would spend <a4_0>1 trillion RMB<a4_0/> (about US $146.5 billion) over the next three years to rebuild areas ravaged by the earthquake, as part of the Chinese economic stimulus program.
